adjective.description: Of, relating to, or characteristic of the chelonian suborder Cryptodira (which includes most kinds of turtle, tortoise, and terrapin), characterized by retraction of the head directly backwards into the shell by a vertical flexure of the neck.

origin: Late 19th century; earliest use found in Geological Magazine. From scientific Latin Cryptodira, suborder name (E. D. Cope 1867 or earlier; alteration of Cryptodera from French Cryptodères, subfamily name from crypto- + ancient Greek δειρή (Attic δέρη) neck: see derotremate) + -an.
